fields.description:
Using mult-object delete, failures to delete individual keys do not result in an error status. A 200 HTTP status is returned with a XML payload that indicates which files succeeded and which failed. The console needs to examine the returned lists and report appropriately.

from boto session:
>>> result = b.delete_keys(keys=['morefiles/100_2340.JPG', 'morefiles/100_2408.JPG', 'morefiles/baby possum.jpg'])
>>> print result
<boto.s3.multidelete.MultiDeleteResult object at 0x10b3ca690>
>>> print vars(result)
{'deleted': [], 'DeleteResult': '', 'errors': [<Error: morefiles/100_2340.JPG(AccessDenied)>, <Error: morefiles/100_2408.JPG(AccessDenied)>, <Error: morefiles/baby possum.jpg(AccessDenied)>], 'bucket': None}
fields.summary: Multi-object delete fails to return errors (if there are any)

comments.body: [~dkavanagh]: How would I force object deletes to return failures here?

I think Adam and I were talking about this in IRC. I found a way, but guess he didn't see that.

If you create a bucket on account A, share it, write an object that's read-only.
then in Account B, write objects into that bucket then try to delete all, you should get an error about the one.

[~dkavanagh]: In your statement "If you create a bucket on account A, share it...", could you clarify what you mean by "share it" (and the steps involved)?  Would I grant full control to account B via bucket ACLs in account A?
yes, [~kgill], you'd need to give full permissions to all or account B at least in order for account b to write and delete objects.

[~dkavanagh]: I'm observing a few anomalies with this, testing on QA shared setup #2.  

First, the "Some keys couldn't be deleted... " alert only displays for a second or so on the first delete attempt.  Subsequent attempts keep the alert around as expected.  

Second, if I log in as account A and grant object "foo" read-only to account B and object "bar" that gives account B full control, the delete operation (performed via account B) fails to delete object "bar".  Is that expected?

I saw a failure to delete w/ 6 objects, at least one of those is owned by the bucket owner (a different account).

The shared bucket grants full control to authenticated users, so anything a different account can write there, it should be able to delete. The fact that these aren't deleting isn't the UI issue. The API response indicates this pretty precisely:
(Pdb) [<Error: Coffee-or-beer.png(AccessDenied)>, <Error: Screen Shot 2015-09-17 at 11.42.49 AM.png(AccessDenied)>, <Error: Screen Shot 2015-09-17 at 11.43.09 AM.png(AccessDenied)>, <Error: cloud-init-eucaconsole.txt(AccessDenied)>, <Error: cloud-init-reqgen.txt(AccessDenied)>, <Error: cloud-init-wordpress.txt(AccessDenied)>]

I try deleting an individual item I just uploaded also fails.
Need to re-test this once EUCA-11513 is addressed.
Keeping this open, scoped for 4.2.1, since verification of this is blocked by EUCA-11513
if linked euca bug is fixed in 4.2.1 we don't need to do this at all, just need to re-test. If they don't fix it we need this in 4.2.1.
[~dkavanagh] just a heads-up that the linked back end bug is in QA and should make it into 4.2.1.
Yes, I've been waiting for the QA cloud to be fixed all morning so I can verify the fix.
I've tested against current maint-4.2 and do not see the problem. The fix [~swathi] did to the storage service seems to have worked!
